content.content: I met up with my friend again today, and we headed out to Tokyo for a little. Our destination was Akihabara, and there we went to a maid cafe. I had wanted to try one, but it was definitely not a place that I could go to alone, so I was glad that he offered to take me there. We went to Maidreamin which is a major maid cafe chain, and it was a bit overwhelming but pretty fun. They bring your food and make you participate in little charms/spells. Probably to people who don't watch anime, none of this makes sense, but if you do then you'll know what's going on.

content.japanese: 夢の国へのパスポート

content.content: Once we left the maid cafe, we walked around Akihabara in the rain a bit, and visited a few manga stores as I went on a quest to look for things to read over the summer. We did find a few stores that had what we were looking for and I bought a lot of manga and a few novels, and have plans to buy more when I head back tomorrow.

After shopping we came back to Yokohama, parted ways, and I just wandered the city for a bit. I went to Chinatown yesterday but didn't try much of the food, so went back and grabbed myself some grilled soup dumplings. After eating those, I went back to the area my hotel is at, Minato Mirai, and just walked around for a while, and went on the big Ferris Wheel. I didn't get any good pictures from inside the thing, but got a decent one of it from a distance.
